name: knapweed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of several wild plants with strong stems and purple flowers, often found in grass or on the sides of roads: On the grassy banks along the track, wild flowers such as cranesbill and knapweed grow. The road verges were thick with purple flower heads of knapweed.
More examplesFewer examplesSpotted knapweed will very quickly drive out other plants.Drought weakens native plants and offers an opening for knapweed to take hold.Another approach is to control the knapweed with natural predators.
